headline: Gold rebounds, Palantir shares slide, UBS boosts airline stocks
summary: Market Domination co-host Julie Hyman tracks today’s top market stories in this Market Minute. Moody’s downgrade on US credit brings the agency's rating in line with ratings from Fitch and S&P, while gold (GC=F) rebounds as investors move to safe havens. Palantir Technologies (PLTR) shares are sliding after recent record highs amid valuation concerns. Meanwhile, UBS upgrades shares of United Airlines (UAL) and Delta Air Lines (DAL) to a Buy rating, citing improved outlooks for international and premium travel. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Palantir Stock Starts the Week Lower. What’s Dragging the Shares Down.
summary: Palantir  was starting the week lower as shares of the artificial-intelligence company declined early Monday.  Shares declined 2.5% to $126.28.  There appeared to be no material news driving shares lower on Monday; rather, a recent run-up in price could be to blame.

headline: Palantir Stock Slides Monday After Hitting Record High Last Week
summary: Shares of Palantir slid Monday amid a broader market decline as investors reacted to a U.S. credit downgrade from Moody’s.

headline: Billionaire Stanley Druckenmiller Dumped Nvidia Last Year. Now He Just Sold All of His Shares of a Market-Beating Monster AI Stock That's Soared 1,500% Over the Past 3 Years.
summary: Druckenmiller sold Nvidia as it continued to soar and even expressed regret about the decision -- but the move still represented an investing win for him.  Let's take a closer look at this latest billionaire bet.
